title: Gratipay Website CSP "script-scr" includes "unsafe-inline"

profile.name: Gratipay
profile.about: Gratitude? Gratipay! The easiest way for your company to pay for open source.

vulnerability_information:
Summary:
========
The HTTP header of the gratipay.com website includes an unsafe CSP parameter for "script-src".

Description:
==========
has a Content-Security-Policy configured the "script-src" parameter is set to "unsafe-inline", which allows injection of user passed values, which in result can be misused for Cross-Site Scripting attacks.

Steps to Reproduce:
================
Go to the following link to check your gratipay.com website's http header response: https://hackertarget.com/http-header-check/
``` Content-Security-Policy-Report-Only: default-src self;script-src self assets.gratipay.com unsafe-inline;```

As can be seen, "unsafe-inline" is included in in the list of "script-src" parameters. For further information, see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy/script-src

Similar Report: #225833
------------------------
vulnerability_information_html:
Summary:

The HTTP header of the gratipay.com website includes an unsafe CSP parameter for "script-src".

Description:

has a Content-Security-Policy configured the "script-src" parameter is set to "unsafe-inline", which allows injection of user passed values, which in result can be misused for Cross-Site Scripting attacks.

Steps to Reproduce:

Go to the following link to check your gratipay.com website's http header response: https://hackertarget.com/http-header-check/
Content-Security-Policy-Report-Only: default-src self;script-src self assets.gratipay.com unsafe-inline;

As can be seen, "unsafe-inline" is included in in the list of "script-src" parameters. For further information, see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy/script-src

Similar Report: #225833

activities.message:
Hi,

Thank you for your report, the receipt of which we herewith confirm. We are currently verifying the issue you reported.

Please expect additional feedback from us within the next couple of days. The "INFORMATION SECURITY" section of the following page has additional, useful information regarding our platform's security: http://inside.gratipay.com/howto/manage-risk

We appreciate your interest in securing our platform and look forward to working with you.

Yours sincerely,
The Gratipay Security Team

activities.message: Thanks, @smziaurrashid. Closing as informative, because our [policy](http://hackerone.com/gratipay) clearly states that issues that can be detected with automated tools are not in scope and this "issue" does not warrant a fix until someone can demonstrate an actual vulnerability.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks, @smziaurrashid. Closing as informative, because our policy clearly states that issues that can be detected with automated tools are not in scope and this "issue" does not warrant a fix until someone can demonstrate an actual vulnerability.

activities.message:
Hello @whit537,
Thanks for your reply. You can check http header using curl -l linux command. And I'm sorry as I'm not interested to disclose this report publicaly. Please don't disclose this report publicaly. thank you!
activities.markdown_message:
Hello @whit537,
Thanks for your reply. You can check http header using curl -l linux command. And I'm sorry as I'm not interested to disclose this report publicaly. Please don't disclose this report publicaly. thank you!

activities.message:
Our policy also states that we disclose all issues publicly:

> Please note that, as an [open organization](http://inside.gratipay.com/big-picture/welcome), our policy is to [fully disclose](http://inside.gratipay.com/appendices/disclosures) all resolved, informative, and not applicable issues, in the interest of openness and transparency for our customers.

If you do not wish to disclose issues publicly, please do not submit reports to our program.
